Numerous studies have shown that organic and biological fertilizers alone or in combination with chemical fertilizers can increase the amount of secondary metabolites and DPPH radical scavenging activity
69â€“ 71 . Low-concentration nitrogen oxide can protect cells against oxidation, but at high levels, in combination with H 2O 2, it can have detrimental effects on cells, which causes toxicity. This toxicity leads to membrane damage (MDA), and DNA disorder. These toxic effects are alleviated by naturally-occurring plant extracts and antioxidants
72 . Also, broccoli extract has shown stronger antioxidant and DPPH scavenging activities when organic and biological fertilizers were applied
73 .
